troubleshooting.title: Setting a Specific JVM Version on Mac OS X

condition.title: Problem
condition.p: On Mac OS X, I need to configure to run with a specific version of Java virtual machine (JVM).

cause.title: Cause
cause.p: uses the first JVM from the list of preferred JVM versions set on your Mac computer that has a version number .

steps-informal.p: You can move your desired JVM version up in the preferred list by dragging it with the mouse to a higher position in the list of JVMs available in the Java Preferences panel that is opened from Applications Utilities Java Java Preferences .
